concept_data.title: International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology

summary: The International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (ICGEB) plays a pivotal role in advancing biotechnological research and development, particularly in developing countries. Established under the auspices of the United Nations, the ICGEB fosters international collaboration and innovation in genetic engineering. Within the EU legal and regulatory framework, the Centre's activities align with policies promoting sustainable development and biotechnology safety. The ICGEB also contributes to the harmonization of scientific standards, facilitating compliance with EU regulations on genetic engineering. By enhancing global scientific cooperation, the ICGEB supports the EU's objectives in fostering responsible biotechnological advancements.
